Parsing newlines while reading from ascii files
Toronto Perl Mongers: Get Help with a snippet of Code: Parsing newlines while reading from ascii files
By Wade Neuwirth on Thursday, June 21, 2001 - 01:38 pm:

Please forgive me for being a newbie. I am trying to create a Perl script that will parse a text file, grab some ID numbers and then substr them into a certain length and create a new file with the new numbers. I have almost all of this working except I do not know how to split a file into an array by newline. The delimiter in the file can change between , . ; | or tab or newline. I have included the code I have written. I just need to know how I can parse this out. Even if I can have the user chose his delimiter but the newline is the thing I am having the problem with. Any help is greatly apreciated.

print "Please choose path to your ascii file:^#92;n";
$ascii_path = ;
chomp $ascii_path;

print "^#92;n^#92;nPlease choose a starting character postion:";
$start_char = ;
chomp $start_char;

print "^#92;n^#92;nHow long should your finished string be...:";
$string_length = ;
chomp $string_length;

$ascii_file = $ascii_path;

open(FILE1, $ascii_file);
while ()
&#123;
chomp;
@LOAD1 = split(/^#92;n/);
&#125;;
close(FILE1);

open(FILE2, ">$ascii_file new");
foreach $LOAD1 (@LOAD1)
&#123;
chomp $LOAD1;
print FILE2 (substr("$LOAD1",($start_char-1),$string_length)).",^#92;n";
&#125;;

print "^#92;n@LOAD1";

;
